newsitem.title: USA: April cash crude grades steady in late U.S. market.
newsitem.headline: April cash crude grades steady in late U.S. market.

text.p: Price differentials for U.S. domestic cash crude grades steadied in late Friday activity, with most of the market focused on finishing April business.

Outright crude prices declined around 35 cents in the May NYMEX futures contract, down to around $21.50 a barrel. Traders said the late call on the April/May West Texas Intermediate roll put the spread at +15/20 cts, equating benchmark April WTI/Cushing at $21.65-70 a barrel.
The roll will be in play for the next few sessions, as traders evalute their physical positions ahead of April pipeline scheduling deadlines on Tuesday.
